item.title: At Learner to Leader: Avoid Costly Mistakes: Backing Up Your Power Platform Development Environment
item.description: What Would Happen If You Lost Your Dev Environment? Ever wondered what would happen if someone accidentally deleted your development site or overwrote a key flow? Rebuilding from memory isn’t just frustrating — it’s costly. This post walks through the process I demonstrated during my session with the Power Platform Learner to Leader community, showing how to automatically back up your environment using Azure DevOps, without requiring advanced YAML knowledge.

item.title: At the Virtual Power Platform User Group Presenting - Avoid Costly Mistakes: Backing Up Your Power Platform Development Environment
item.description: What Would Happen If You Lost Your Dev Environment? Ever wondered what would happen if someone accidentally deleted your development site or overwrote a key flow? Rebuilding from memory isn’t just frustrating — it’s costly. This post walks through the process I demonstrated during my session with the Power Platform Learner to Leader community, showing how to automatically back up your environment using Azure DevOps, without requiring advanced YAML knowledge.

item.title: Backup Dataverse Development Environment
item.description: Introduction Ever wondered what would happen if you lost your development environment? How do you feel about having to do all of that work again? What about if you spot a problem days later? Can you remember the value you changed three days ago in that flow? Have you ever seen someone delete the website record by mistake. These are all situations I have been in over the last few years, and having a Pipeline in place to ensure backup of your hard work is extremely important.
